unnormalised: Property prices in Mumbai continue to defy gravity, folks! A recent listing for a 1BHK in Bandra went viral – a mere 350 sq ft priced at a cool ₹3.5 crores. Yes, you read that right, folks. You could buy a small island in some parts of the world for that kind of dough.
normalised: Property prices in Mumbai continue to defy gravity, folks! A recent listing for a one B-H-K in Bandra went viral – a mere three hundred and fifty square feet priced at a cool rupee three point five crores. Yes, you read that right, folks. You could buy a small island in some parts of the world for that kind of dough.

unnormalised: "Sea-facing" apparently means you can *maybe* glimpse the sea if you lean precariously out of the window while simultaneously balancing a cup of chai. And the "amenities"? Well, there’s a lift that works 60% of the time and a watchman named Raju who knows all the best gossip.
normalised: "Sea-facing" apparently means you can *maybe* glimpse the sea if you lean precariously out of the window while simultaneously balancing a cup of chai. And the "amenities"? Well, there’s a lift that works sixty percent of the time and a watchman named Raju who knows all the best gossip.

unnormalised: Real estate agents are spinning this as "investment potential". Investment potential for whom, exactly? Maybe future generations who'll have to sell their kidneys to afford the annual property tax. One broker, calling himself "RealEstateGuru420" online, claimed this was a steal, comparing it to Monaco's price per sq ft, completely missing the point about, you know, Monaco being, well, Monaco.
normalised: Real estate agents are spinning this as "investment potential". Investment potential for whom, exactly? Maybe future generations who'll have to sell their kidneys to afford the annual property tax. One broker, calling himself "R-e-a-l-E-s-t-a-t-e-G-u-r-u four hundred and twenty" online, claimed this was a steal, comparing it to Monaco's price per square foot, completely missing the point about, you know, Monaco being, well, Monaco.

unnormalised: My auto-rickshaw driver, Ramu kaka, put it best: "Itna paisa mein toh main pura gaon kharid lega, beta!" (For that much money, I could buy an entire village, son!). He's thinking of starting a rival agency specializing in "rural real estate opportunities". Watch out, "RealEstateGuru420"!
normalised: My auto-rickshaw driver, Ramu kaka, put it best: "Itna paisa mein toh main pura gaon kharid lega, beta!" (For that much money, I could buy an entire village, son!). He's thinking of starting a rival agency specializing in "rural real estate opportunities". Watch out, "R-e-a-l-E-s-t-a-t-e-G-u-r-u four hundred and twenty"!

unnormalised: So, if you're dreaming of owning a piece of Mumbai's skyline, start saving now. Or maybe consider Ramu kaka's village option. Just saying.
normalised: So, if you're dreaming of owning a piece of Mumbai's skyline, start saving now. Or maybe consider Ramu kaka's village option. Just saying.
